properties.media:imagetext:
PAA
PAN AMERICAN WORLD AIRWAYS SYSTEM
CHRYSLER BUILDING, 135 EAST 42ND STREET, NEW YORK 17, N. Y.
executive orrices
June 16, 1949
Mrs. H. M. Bixby
Bolton Landing
New York
Dear Mrs. Bixby:
I return herewith the original letter from Mr. Bixby
which I have
copied and mailed to your daughters as per your
request.
Concerning your inquiry re foreign stamps
- yes,
we do
collect them for a gentleman who stops in (rather in-
frequently) for this purpose and who also distributes them
to veterans.
Since the preponderance of our foreign mail
originates in China we accumulate largely Chinese stamps; I
enclose some to add to your
next group.
A letter has arrived from Mr. Bixby written June 10th
and, as requested in an accompenying note, I enclose copies
for yourself and your daughters or whatever use you may wish
to put them to.
As instructed by Mr.
Bixby, I also furnished
copies to Mr. Ingalls and the Dunlops in Chevy Chase.
Mr. William Lyons unexpectedly 'phoned yesterday to say
he was in town until tomorrow and to advise that the sub-lease
proposal for next winter was entirely agreeable to him.
At
the same time he stressed the importance of the Management
being kept out of the arrangements.
Meanwhile, your
letters
on this same subject arrived and I immediately
contacted Mr.
Lyons and read your messages to him.
He planned to
" phone
you this afternoon since he departs New York tomorrow.
New York has been stifling this
past week,
but a breeze
has struck up now making it more
livable.
After almost three
weeks drought we had a little rain last night, not enough,
however,
to undo the damage to our lawn and garden which are
very parched.
P.S.
Sincerely,
Aacqueline Tagan
Was immensely pleased to hear that The Case of the
Missing Cufflinks et al had been solved ! ! !
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Jacqueline Fagan to Debby Bixby
